intro: Ixia monanthos, commonly known as the yellow lily or the African lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Ixia monanthos thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its blooming period occurs in late winter to early spring, adding a vibrant splash of color to the landscape.
